benchmark_details.name: MQAD (Music Question Answering Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: MQAD is a large-scale music QA dataset based on the Million Song Dataset, including over 270,000 tracks and nearly 3 million QA pairs that cover various aspects of music, such as beat, chord, key, structure, instrument, and genre.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to provide a comprehensive dataset for training and evaluating multimodal LLMs in music question answering.

data.annotation: Generated using specialized MIR models and LLMs to create high-quality QA pairs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons between predicted answers and ground truth across various musical dimensions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in metrics indicate better performance in accurately answering music-related questions.
methodology.baseline_results: MMQAD-B model performance outperformed others across all metrics on the MQAD test set.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through detailed testing of QA capabilities across various music information retrieval tasks.
